project.description:
This task is meant to be called as part of another task, which we call the parent task. This parent task is usually intended for setting up a testing node that requires a host certificate. You can call this task with 'Build on the same node' parameter using the following input parameters:
SUB_CA=(string) (optional) An alias for the sub CA you want to create SUB_CA_CN=(string) (optional) The CN of the sub CA you want to create
Note : By default the new host certificate is signed with the root CA. If you want to create and use an intermediate sub CA instead, you must specify both SUB_CA_CN and SUB_CA! In case the specified SUB_CA is recognized as previously created no new sub CA will be created, instead the old one gets reused. This means that it is safe to pass 'rootCA' as SUB_CA, because this will have the same effect as not passing any SUB_CA value.
Calls certificate-master.create-certificate to create a host certificate with CN=$NODE_NAME and deploys it into /etc/grid-security. Moreover, it also calls certificates-master.update-certificates to update /etc/grid-security/certificates to the latest ca bundle.
TODO: /etc/grid-security and it's content should be owned by root (depending on the scenario) TODO: Automatically create signing policies because more and more services require them (the right place for this might be in the CA creating script)

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
CN=$HOSTNAME CA=${SUB_CA:-rootCA} CERT="C=NL,O=Example,OU=PDP,CN=${CN}.crt" KEY="C=NL,O=Example,OU=PDP,CN=${CN}.key"
tar xzf cert_testdir.tar.gz
sudo mkdir -p /etc/grid-security sudo mv -f "`readlink -f "cert_testdir/${CA}/aliases/${CERT}"`" /etc/grid-security/hostcert.pem sudo chmod 644 /etc/grid-security/hostcert.pem sudo mv -f "`readlink -f "cert_testdir/${CA}/aliases/${KEY}"`" /etc/grid-security/hostkey.pem sudo chmod 400 /etc/grid-security/hostkey.pem
#+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ # creating signing policies. this bit should be moved later on into the certificate creating functions
CERTIFICATES=cert_testdir/certificates/
for ca in `find "${CERTIFICATES}" -type f -name *.pem`; do hash=`openssl x509 -in "${ca}" -subject_hash -noout` hash_old=`openssl x509 -in "${ca}" -subject_hash_old -noout` subject=`openssl x509 -in "${ca}" -subject -noout | sed s/^subject=\ //` cond_subjects=`echo "${subject}" | sed s/CN=.*/\*/`
cat > "${CERTIFICATES}/${hash}.signing_policy" <<EOF access_id_CA X509 '${subject}' pos_rights globus CA:sign cond_subjects globus '"${cond_subjects}"' EOF ln -f -s "${hash}.signing_policy" "${CERTIFICATES}/${hash_old}.signing_policy" done
#+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
sudo mkdir -p /etc/grid-security/certificates/ sudo mv -f cert_testdir/certificates/* /etc/grid-security/certificates/
